intro: Crotalaria macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stalked crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated, spindle-shaped pods, which split open when mature to release the seeds. Crotalaria macrostachya is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
